alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 10:37AM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. .Recent rain and snowfall have resulted in river rises on the East Branch of the Escanaba River at Gwinn. The previous flood advisory is being upgraded to a flood warning. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Low lying areas of Peter Nordeen Park begin to flood * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:07 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:07 AM EDT Tuesday was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 7.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening to 5.2 feet Thursday evening. It will rise above flood stage early Sunday morning to 7.2 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage again Monday evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.9 feet on 04/17/2002. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 245 AM EDT.
